description: From French similaire, from Medieval Latin similaris, extended from Latin similis (“like”); akin to simul (“together”).

adjectives.description: similar (comparative more similar, superlative most similar)

entries.meaning: Having traits or characteristics in common; alike, comparable.
examples: My new car is similar to my old one, except it has a bit more space in the back.

entries.meaning: (mathematics) Of geometrical figures including triangles, squares, ellipses, arcs and more complex figures, having the same shape but possibly different size, rotational orientation, and position; in particular, having corresponding angles equal and corresponding line segments proportional; such that one can be had from the other using a sequence of rotations, translations and scalings.
(mathematics, linear algebra) Of two square matrices; being such that a conjugation sends one matrix to the other.
That which is similar to, or resembles, something else, as in quality, form, etc.
(homeopathy) A material that produces an effect that resembles the symptoms of a particular disease.
